intro: Daucus royenii, commonly known as the Royen cow parsley, is a rare and endangered species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic compounds. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Due to habitat loss and climate change, conservation efforts are crucial for its survival.
